title: "True damage offers pretty clear feedback: the damage you see is the damage you get...
body:
...no decreases or increases. Mountain Drake was violating that expectation (especially around smite fights), so we’re bringing it in line with the rest of the game."


Turrets
Turrets now take less true damage when the backdoor bonus is in effect.

Turrets have always had a pretty massive defensive boost to discourage raw backdoor attempts, but with the increased prevalence of True Damage in the game (Mountain Drake, Red Buff) we’re adjusting to keep it in line.
REALLY REINFORCED ARMOR Now additionally absorbs 66% of true damage when the backdoor bonus is in effect

lol

replies.body:
Yep, that's not a great approach and we do want to maintain clarity around how  true damage functions. We threw that change in as a temporary band aid though to address some abuse cases with some champs backdooring really effectively without minions late game via true damage. Wasn't happening too often, given the need to get some Earth Drakes for it to be really effective, lacked sufficient ways to respond to it when it did though.

For an upcoming patch (possibly 6.11, not sure yet) we're investigating ways to address that issue without violating the rule that nothing makes true damage deal more or less damage, though things may absorb it (e.g. Janna shield) or be immune to it (e.g. Kayle ult). Best argument so far is to simply have the backdoor bonus on turrets make them immune to true damage entirely, though that's not a guaranteed approach yet.

Best argument so far is to simply have the backdoor bonus on turrets make them immune to true damage entirely, though that's not a guaranteed approach yet.

Easiest solution: remove "true damage" from red buff and mountain dragon (against turrets only) and rework them to do bonus physical or magical damage based on your higher stat (AD or AP), and buff the numbers a bit so they do the same damage that they did when it was true damage. It would be similar to the old dragon that did magic damage instead of true damage to turrets. The only reason you'd need to code it to do physical OR magical (based on your stats) would be because penetration against turrets is a thing now.

.....Or just leave it alone, and let "true damage" be reduced against turrets with the backdoor bonus in effect. From a "clarity" standpoint it's fine, really. We're lucky we can even do true damage AT ALL to turrets. It never used to be a thing. Before Krugz existed, it wasn't a thing at all. Ever. If the "clarity" of it is really bothering you, then add a tooltip to the turrets when you highlight them with no minions around. If a tooltip isn't enough (since most experienced players disable "new player tooltips"), then add an actual text that appears above the turret (similar to how text appears when minions get killed and give you gold, or how text appears when you do damage to things, etc), and make it say in BIG BRIGHT RED LETTERS each time you autoattack the turret: **_"BACKDOOR BONUS IN EFFECT: ALL DAMAGE REDUCED, INCLUDING TRUE DAMAGE"_**

How about just giving turrets a 500 point shield when no minions are nearby that refreshes on taking damage.

If what you wanted to do was making it difficult rather than plain impossible to take a tower with no minions nearby, reduce the shield from 500 to 100.

Honestly, turrets shouldn't even have backdoor armor or backdoor damage reduction in the first place because it specifically diminishes non-true damage, and clearly that isn't what you want.

If you change it all to a shield, and then find that magic and physical damage dealers cannot back door at all, but you want them to be able to, then have the turret's backdoor-shield's maximum health permanently diminish by 5% of the physical and magic damage it blocks every time it blocks damage.

This rewards repetitive and unrelenting backdooring against a single turret, which is fair because it is gives the enemy team plenty of time to react. It amortizes the value of having true damage to be appoximately the same as not having true damage, since most of the time spent backdooring is spent making multiple trips against the tower to whittle the shield's blocking power, which doesn't care about your true damage.

How about a buff that exists only while the Backdoor Buff is active. "This structure rapidly heals all true damage dealt to it".

Then it gets gray health from true damage which heals at 20% per second. You can still knock the turret down, but if someone comes to stop you they get rewarded.

How about this backdoor bonus:

When protected by bonus fortification, towers become supercharged by true damage, increasing their damage by 1% for 10 seconds for each point of true damage they take.

So long as your looking into stuff like that, I think Skuttle is still taking increased true damage when stunned.
